title: Trump and Zelenskyy meet to talk about ending Ukraine war
snippets: Zelenskyy and Trump have met in Mar-a-Lago in Florida to discuss a 20-point plan to end the war in Ukraine. Turmp said he would call Putin after the meeting. DW has the latest.
Trump: Russia and Ukraine peace talks in "final stages" Axios
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was scheduled to arrive at Mar-a-Lago in President Donald Trump's latest attempt to end the war with Russia.

Call with European leaders is also slated to take place during meeting The Ukrainian military said on Sunday that it hit the Syzran oil refinery in Russia’s Samara region in an overnight drone attack. The strike caused a fire and damages were still being assessed, Kyiv’s General Staff said. Continue
Zelenskyy said he will raise “territorial issues” as Moscow and Kyiv remain fiercely at odds over the fate of the Donbas region in eastern Ukraine.
President Donald Trump welcomed Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to his Florida resort Sunday after speaking with Russian President Vladimir Putin by phone.
titles: Ukraine: Trump meets Zelenskyy, says talks in 'final stages'

summary: Former President Donald Trump met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy at Mar-a-Lago in Florida to discuss a 20-point plan aimed at ending the war in Ukraine. Trump spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin by phone before the meeting and stated that Russia-Ukraine peace talks are in the "final stages." Zelenskyy said he would address territorial issues, particularly regarding the Donbas region. Meanwhile, Ukraine reported a drone strike on a Russian oil refinery.

summary: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro underwent a medical procedure to treat severe hiccups after experiencing spasms for nine months, according to his wife. He was already hospitalized for hernia surgery at the time. The procedure was conducted successfully, and he is recovering in hospital.

title: New York City subway will stop using MetroCards after 2025
snippets: The iconic card was swiped by millions daily for the past 32 years and will be retired Dec. 31.
New York subway ends its MetroCard era and switches fully to tap-and-go fares AP News

NEW YORK (AP) — When the MetroCard replaced the New York City subway token in 1994, the swipeable plastic card infused much-needed modernity into one of the world’s oldest and largest transit systems. summary: New York City's subway system will retire the MetroCard on December 31, 2025, ending its use after 32 years. The system will fully transition to tap-and-go fare payment methods, marking the end of the MetroCard era that began in 1994 when it replaced subway tokens.

title: Big winter storm brings heavy snow and cold to Midwest
snippets: A powerful winter storm is impacting parts of the U.S. with major snowfall, ice, and below zero wind chills. The conditions are disrupting holiday travel and could last through next week.
Snowfall totals were expected to exceed a foot across parts of the upper Great Lakes, with up to two feet (61 centimetres) possible along the south shore of Lake Superior.
titles: Winter storm brings heavy snow and ice to busy holiday travel weekend
U.S. holiday travel at risk as winter storm threatens blizzards and ice
constructiveness_reason: This story informs the reader about a current event that could impact their plans, providing some actionable insights (e.g., potentially needing to adjust travel plans). However, it does not report on solutions or improvements, and it does not significantly increase clarity around systems, causes, trends, or impacts.
summary: A major winter storm is affecting parts of the U.S., bringing heavy snowfall, ice, and dangerously low wind chills. Snowfall totals are expected to exceed a foot in the upper Great Lakes region, with up to two feet possible along Lake Superior's south shore. The storm is disrupting holiday travel and is forecast to continue into next week.
